meanings.definition: A mode of behavior or way of thought peculiar to an individual.
meanings.sent1: Her idiosyncrasy of always wearing mismatched socks made her stand out.
meanings.sent2: His idiosyncrasy of humming to himself while working was endearing to his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: It was his idiosyncrasy of eating pizza with a fork that always made his friends chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The idiosyncrasy of her laughter sounding like a dolphin's call was unmistakable.
meanings.sent5: The idiosyncrasy of his habit of counting steps before entering a room was both fascinating and puzzling.

meanings.definition: A characteristic, habit, mannerism, or quirk that is unique to an individual.
meanings.sent1: One idiosyncrasy of his was collecting vintage stamps.
meanings.sent2: Her idiosyncrasy of always carrying a lucky charm gave her a sense of comfort.
meanings.sent3: The idiosyncrasy of his fear of clowns was known to all his friends.
meanings.sent4: The idiosyncrasy of her love for organizing her bookshelf by color was both charming and efficient.
meanings.sent5: His idiosyncrasy of needing to have a bedtime story read to him every night was a source of amusement for his family.
